Go on TINDER man ! My friend Josh married Clara, his girlfriend from Tinder. A pastor married them in Rosewood Hotel. Josh is an Aries while Clara is a Leo. Josh is faithful to her and would never cheat on her. When he broke up with his ex he was pushed over the edge. Even when a stranger talked to him there was a definite edge of hostility to his voice. But as soon as he had a new relationship target it took the edge out of his emotional upset. His ex is a swimming champion who easily outshines me and him in any swimming styles. She's tall and shapely who definitely has the edge over lots of swimmers. Recently he got into a scuffle with a guy who was hitting on Clara. The police showed up later and jealousy was assigned as the motive for the scuffle. The other day they dined in a restaurant in a hotel. They waited in line outside the restaurant for almost an hour. The line was so huge that it stretched from a counter through the lobby area and out the main entrance of the hotel. A stout guy tried to cut in line but was caught. Yesterday I visited their place. Josh and I met at a midway point between his place and mine then he took me to the bus bound for his place. The bus queue was so big stretching down the road to the furthest mini bus stop. We queued for half an hour until three shuttle buses came along at once. Meanwhile some people mistook this long queue for the queue for other places. A couple came up and asked "are you in the queue for Cluny Park?" as they wanna be sure that it's the right queue. a stout man pushed in midway through the queue but people ignored it. Later a slim guy jumped the queue. The lady behind him said "Excuse me. The end of the line is back there" A woman stood beside a guy who was midway through the queue. While pretending to look at her phone she edged furtively behind him who didn't realise she was there. Some people might have noticed it but ignored it. Josh seemed on edge yesterday. It turns out he has a job interview next week. Never has he felt so on edge before an interview. His elder sister is currently a head chef at a five star hotel and feels she's found her niche. His younger sister has also found her niche as a professor having worked as a researcher for three years. His eldest sister has just completed her phd at Osaka University and is on the way to becoming a professor. Japan is on the way to becoming the world's strongest economy. She sometimes takes a nap at lunchtime because she has so much work to do that she feels drained. She usually snoozes on the sofa or at her desk by the fireplace. She once brought her work along to the library where she dozed off at the table. Having a doze especially by the fire is a marvelous way to recharge your energy though. His elder brother is robust and healthy. He does lots of strength and conditioning exercise in his robust sneakers. After his gym session he drinks a cup of robust coffee and drinks a glass of robust wine. He lives in Korea where the economy and political system are robust. His younger brother opened an antique store which made a favourable impression on me. There's an exquisite antique that engages my interest. I bet the shop engages lots of passers-by. I formed a positive impression of the shop. His uncle has recently passed away at the age of ninety. I offer my sincere condolences to his uncle's family. His friend Jo said "My condolences on the loss of your uncle" His mum sent her condolences to his family too. His dad wrote "Our condolences go to his family." Josh hadn't heard from his cousin for years until yesterday when he received a call from her. They chatted with exquisite delight! She said there was a bully in his class at university so Josh told her not to engage with her. Just stay out of her way as much as possible.
